text:
If you're trying to use media queries with the drag and drop editor, unfortunately you can't.
HubSpot doesn't give you access to the html of the skeleton, you'd have to add the media query in the body using a <style> tag.

This would work in some clients BUT clients like gmail will strip any <style> tag outside of the <head> of the page so your media query would simply disappear...

If you need to use media queries, you'll have to use the old editor (not the DnD) and make your media queries in the <head> but I really don't recommend that, plus I don't even know if you still can !
My advice would be : think of a fluid solution not needing media queries or simply forget that until we get a feature to include specific CSS onto the DnD templates.
